intro: Sanicula giraldii var. ovicalycina, commonly known as the Sierra sanicle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native ecosystem.
